alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 21 at 7:12PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Wayne and central Pulaski Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 711 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pulaski County Park, or near Somerset, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Somerset Pulaski Airport, Elihu and Pointer around 715 PM EDT. Somerset, Hogue, Stab and Ruth around 720 PM EDT. Science Hill around 725 PM EDT. Dabney and Shopville around 730 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Bobtown, Valley Oak and Woodstock. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 17 and 36. Louis B. Nunn Parkway MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
